headline: Jonathan Clements, Longtime WSJ Columnist, Dies at 62
summary: Last fall,  Jonathan Clements,  author of The Wall Street Journal’s long-running personal-finance column, “Getting Going,” wrote a gut-wrenching article for the Journal about his terminal cancer diagnosis.  Jesting at his own impending death, he proposed to the article’s editors that the headline should be “Getting Gone.”  Clements, 62 years old, died in Philadelphia on Sunday, about a year-and-a-half after being diagnosed with a rare form of lung cancer.

headline: Citi deploys agentic tools to in-house AI platform
summary: The financial services firm began initial rollout of agentic capabilities to 5,000 of its workers this month, according to a Monday announcement.

raw.headline: Citi deploys agentic tools to in-house AI platform
raw.summary: The financial services firm began initial rollout of agentic capabilities to 5,000 of its workers this month, according to a Monday announcement.

headline: AI Agents Arrive at Citi
summary: The financial firm said it would run a 5,000 person pilot to find out how helpful the new “agentic” technology is to staff in areas like research and client profiling.
